channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large items flytipped beginning to block path, 13th July
item.description:
Another incident of flytipping,woke at 0:50am sound of large van, man dragging items out (drawers , part of a bed) I shouted out the window , he drove off ) large yellow van. This mess is accumulating outside my house on a public footpath.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leswin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opening gates on time, 13th July
item.description:
I frequently walk early as an older citizen I like to get out before it is too hot and on numerous occasions Croydon Rec is not open on time and regularly maybe only one or two gates only are open meaning an extra long walk retracing your steps to an original gate. Please sort this out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned mattress, 13th July
item.description:
Someone has fly tipped a household mattress and bag of rubbish near Palazzo apartments on Ardleigh Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ardleigh Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Too hazardous for pedestrians!, 13th July
item.description:
Exiting the southern end of Berkeley Square is extremely hazardous for pedestrians. The pavement opposite is fenced off due to the hoardings, and these also obscure the view of traffic turning left from Berkeley Street. How was this ever sanctioned by the council?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Berkeley Square, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet
